decision_conditions: NO JUSTIFICATION FOR FELLING:  There is judged to be no sound arboricultural or overbearing practical reasons to justify the removal of the protected tree[s], the effect of which would be seriously detrimental to the local amenity.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description:
T1 - Indian Bean Tree, Tree is in major decline, the boughs are connected with weak bark inclusions, we currently have lost a major limb on the back of the tree this has also made the tree become extremely unstable with the only canopy on the extreme lean of the tree,
We would look to remove the tree, due to the brick flower bed where tree is located stump removable wouldn't be possible and garden hosts a mature hedge across its boundary, client happy to replace tree at a different property but is out of the borough, 


T2 - neighbours sycamore reduce over hanging branches by about 1meter,
